alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 16 at 5:11AM PST until further notice by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 709 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Diego. * WHEN...Until 709 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 511 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Diego, Coronado, Chula Vista, Imperial Beach, El Cajon, National City, La Mesa, Alpine, Pine Valley, and Julian. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
